page.title: 15 Rugby & Leisure Pursuits
page.content: Rushden & Higham Rugby Club rent their ground from the council. The club has been in existance for 35 years, their ground and clubhouse being sited just off the Bedford Rd. The committee which runs the club consists of 18 members. They have three sections for the players: senior; colts and mini-rugby section. They enter many cup competitions the highest being the Burt White Shield. The players train at their own club grounds, but sometimes they have to share their field with an archery club from Raunds or dog training classes. They do have some drainage problems as the main pitch gets very wet and muddy. The club has a treatment room, practice pitch and changing rooms. Another growing sport in our Â£D' Block is that of Â£Micro-Light' flying. The pilots use a field along Newton Rd.
